title: Allows municipal commissions to use alternate lists for filling vacancies with resident and non-resident minority group members and women in order to achieve diversity in the workplace
summary: Allows municipal commissions to use alternate lists for filling vacancies with resident and non-resident minority group members and women in order to achieve diversity in the workplace.

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011

       Introduced  by M. of A. PRETLOW, GALEF, LATIMER, CASTRO -- read once and
         referred to the Committee on Governmental Employees

       AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to appointments  from
         eligible lists

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 4 of section 23 of the civil  service  law,  as
    2  amended  by  chapter  647  of  the  laws  of 1995, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    4. Use of state and county eligible lists by municipal commissions.  A
    5  municipal commission, in the absence of an eligible list of its own, may
    6  request the state civil service department, county civil service commis-
    7  sion or county personnel officer to furnish it with the names of persons
    8  on  an  appropriate eligible list established by the department, commis-
    9  sion or personnel officer, which,  if  so  requested  by  the  municipal
   10  commission,  shall be limited to residents of the city, or town or civil
   11  division in which appointments are to be made, or to  residents  of  the
   12  county  or  judicial district in which such city, town or civil division
   13  is located, or to any reasonable combination of  political  subdivisions
   14  both  in  and  outside of New York state contiguous to the city or civil
   15  division in which appointment is to be made or contiguous to  the  poli-
   16  tical  subdivision  in  which  such  city  or civil division is located.
   17  PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT NOTHING CONTAINED HEREIN SHALL PREVENT A MUNICI-
   18  PAL COMMISSION FROM USING ALTERNATE LISTS, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED  TO
   19  THE  COUNTY LIST, FOR THE FILLING OF VACANCIES BY BOTH RESIDENT AND NON-
   20  RESIDENT MINORITY GROUP MEMBERS, AS DEFINED BY SECTION THREE HUNDRED TEN
   21  OF THE EXECUTIVE LAW, AND WOMEN IN ORDER TO  ACHIEVE  DIVERSITY  IN  THE
   22  WORKFORCE. Such municipal commission may certify such names for appoint-
   23  ment  to a position under its jurisdiction in the same manner as certif-
   24  ications are made from the eligible lists of  such  commission.  If  the
   25  state civil service department, county civil service commission or coun-

    1  ty personnel officer, upon the request of such commission, has certified
    2  an  appropriate  eligible  list to fill a particular position, such list
    3  shall continue to be used until superseded by an  eligible  list  estab-
    4  lished  by  such  municipal  commission for such position, or until such
    5  list expires or is exhausted or is otherwise terminated.
    6    S 2. Subdivisions 1 and 2 of section 56 of the civil service  law,  as
    7  amended  by  chapter  411  of  the  laws of 1993, are amended to read as
    8  follows:
    9    1. The duration of an eligible list shall be fixed at  not  less  than
   10  one nor more than four years; provided that, except for lists promulgat-
   11  ed  for police officer positions in jurisdictions other than the city of
   12  New York, in the event that a restriction against the filling of  vacan-
   13  cies  exists  in any jurisdiction, the state civil service department or
   14  municipal commission having jurisdiction shall, in the discretion of the
   15  department or commission, extend the duration of any eligible list for a
   16  period equal to the length of such restriction against  the  filling  of
   17  vacancies.   Restriction against the filling of vacancies shall mean any
   18  policy, whether by executive order or otherwise,  which,  because  of  a
   19  financial  emergency,  prevents  or limits the filling of vacancies in a
   20  title for which a list has been promulgated.   PROVIDED,  HOWEVER,  THAT
   21  NOTHING CONTAINED HEREIN SHALL PREVENT A MUNICIPAL COMMISSION FROM USING
   22  ALTERNATE  LISTS,  INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE COUNTY LIST, FOR THE
   23  FILLING OF VACANCIES BY BOTH RESIDENT AND  NON-RESIDENT  MINORITY  GROUP
   24  MEMBERS,  AS  DEFINED BY SECTION THREE HUNDRED TEN OF THE EXECUTIVE LAW,
   25  AND WOMEN IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE DIVERSITY IN THE  WORKFORCE.  An  eligible
   26  list  that  has  been  in existence for one year or more shall terminate
   27  upon the establishment of an  appropriate  new  list,  unless  otherwise
   28  prescribed by the state civil service department or municipal commission
   29  having jurisdiction.
   30    2.  Notwithstanding  subdivision  one of this section, the duration of
   31  eligible lists established on or before December thirty-first,  nineteen
   32  hundred  ninety-six,  shall  be fixed at not less than one nor more than
   33  four years; provided that, except for lists promulgated for police offi-
   34  cer positions in jurisdictions other than the city of New York,  in  the
   35  event  that a restriction against the filling of vacancies exists in any
   36  jurisdiction, the state civil service department or municipal commission
   37  having jurisdiction shall,  in  the  discretion  of  the  department  or
   38  commission,  extend  the duration of any such eligible list for a period
   39  equal to the length of such restriction against the  filling  of  vacan-
   40  cies.  Restriction against the filling of vacancies shall mean any poli-
   41  cy, whether by executive order or otherwise, which  prevents  or  limits
   42  the  filling  of  vacancies  in  a  title for which such a list has been
   43  promulgated. PROVIDED, HOWEVER,  THAT  NOTHING  CONTAINED  HEREIN  SHALL
   44  PREVENT A MUNICIPAL COMMISSION FROM USING ALTERNATE LISTS, INCLUDING BUT
   45  NOT  LIMITED  TO  THE  COUNTY LIST, FOR THE FILLING OF VACANCIES BY BOTH
   46  RESIDENT AND NON-RESIDENT MINORITY GROUP MEMBERS, AS DEFINED BY  SECTION
   47  THREE  HUNDRED  TEN  OF THE EXECUTIVE LAW, AND WOMEN IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE
   48  DIVERSITY IN THE WORKFORCE. An eligible list that has been in  existence
   49  for one year or more shall terminate upon the establishment of an appro-
   50  priate  new list, unless otherwise prescribed by the state civil service
   51  department or municipal commission having jurisdiction.
   52    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
